com.hazelcast.internal.journal

Interface EventJournal<E>

  • Type Parameters:
    E - journal event type
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    CacheEventJournal, MapEventJournal
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    RingbufferCacheEventJournalImpl, RingbufferMapEventJournalImpl

    public interface EventJournal<E>
    The event journal is a container for events related to a data structure. This interface provides methods for distributed object event journals. Each distributed object and partition has its own event journal.

    If an object is destroyed or migrated, the related event journal will be destroyed or migrated as well. In this regard, the event journal is co-located with the object partition and its replicas.

    Since:
    3.9

      Cleans up the event journal by removing any expired items.

      Destroys the event journal for the given object and partition ID.
      EventJournalConfig getEventJournalConfig(ObjectNamespace namespace)
      Returns the event journal configuration or null if there is none or the journal is disabled for the given namespace.

      Return the WaitNotifyKey for objects waiting and notifying on the event journal.

      Returns true if the event journal has persistence enabled and can be queried for events older than the oldestSequence(ObjectNamespace, int).

      Returns the sequence of the newest event stored in the event journal.

      • newestSequence

        long newestSequence(ObjectNamespace namespace,
                    int partitionId)
        Returns the sequence of the newest event stored in the event journal.
        Parameters:
        namespace - the object namespace
        partitionId - the partition ID of the event journal
        Returns:
        the sequence of the last stored event
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if there is no event journal configured for this object

        partitionId - the partition ID of the event journal
        Returns:

        Throws:

      • isPersistenceEnabled

        boolean isPersistenceEnabled(ObjectNamespace namespace,
                             int partitionId)
        Returns true if the event journal has persistence enabled and can be queried for events older than the oldestSequence(ObjectNamespace, int). If the journal is not backed by a persistent store, this method will return false.
        Parameters:
        namespace - the object namespace
        partitionId - the partition ID of the event journal
        Returns:
        if the journal is backed by a persistent store and can serve events older than the oldest sequence
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if there is no event journal configured for this object

      • destroy

        void destroy(ObjectNamespace namespace,
             int partitionId)
        Destroys the event journal for the given object and partition ID.
        Parameters:
        namespace - the object namespace
        partitionId - the partition ID of the entries in the journal

      • isAvailableOrNextSequence

        void isAvailableOrNextSequence(ObjectNamespace namespace,
                               int partitionId,
                               long sequence)
        Checks if the sequence is of an item that can be read immediately or is the sequence of the next item to be added into the event journal. Since this method allows the sequence to be one larger than the newestSequence(ObjectNamespace, int), the caller can use this method to check the sequence before performing a possibly blocking read.
        Parameters:
        namespace - the object namespace
        partitionId - the partition ID of the entries in the journal
        sequence - the sequence wanting to be read
        Throws:
        StaleSequenceException - if the requested sequence is smaller than the sequence of the oldest event (the sequence has been overwritten)
        IllegalArgumentException - if the requested sequence is greater than the next available sequence + 1
        IllegalStateException - if there is no event journal configured for this object

      • isNextAvailableSequence

        boolean isNextAvailableSequence(ObjectNamespace namespace,
                                int partitionId,
                                long sequence)
        Checks if the sequence is the sequence of the next event to be added to the event journal.
        Parameters:
        namespace - the object namespace
        partitionId - the partition ID of the entries in the journal
        sequence - the sequence to be checked
        Returns:
        true if the sequence is one greater than the sequence of the last event, false otherwise
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if there is no event journal configured for this object

      • getWaitNotifyKey

        WaitNotifyKey getWaitNotifyKey(ObjectNamespace namespace,
                               int partitionId)
        Return the WaitNotifyKey for objects waiting and notifying on the event journal.
        Parameters:
        namespace - the object namespace
        partitionId - the partition ID of the entries in the journal
        Returns:
        the key for a wait notify object
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if there is no event journal configured for this object

      • readMany

        <T> long readMany(ObjectNamespace namespace,
                  int partitionId,
                  long beginSequence,
                  ReadResultSetImpl<E,T> resultSet)
        Reads events from the journal in batches. It will read up to the maximum number that the set can hold - see ReadResultSetImpl.isMaxSizeReached() or until the journal is exhausted. The resultSet allows filtering and projections on journal items so that the caller can control which data is returned.

        If the set has reached its max size, the returned sequence is one greater than the sequence of the last item in the set. In other cases it means that the set hasn't reached its full size because we have reached the end of the event journal. In this case the returned sequence is one greater than the sequence of the last stored event.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the return type of the projected events
        Parameters:
        namespace - the object namespace
        partitionId - the partition ID of the entries in the journal
        beginSequence - the sequence of the first item to read.
        resultSet - the container for read, filtered and projected events
        Returns:
        returns the sequenceId of the next item to read
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if there is no event journal configured for this object
        StaleSequenceException - if the requested sequence is smaller than the sequence of the oldest event
        IllegalArgumentException - if the requested sequence is greater than the sequence of the newest event + 1
        See Also:
        isAvailableOrNextSequence(ObjectNamespace, int, long)

      • cleanup

        void cleanup(ObjectNamespace namespace,
             int partitionId)
        Cleans up the event journal by removing any expired items. Items are considered expired according to the configured expiration policy.
        Parameters:
        namespace - the object namespace
        partitionId - the partition ID of the entries in the journal
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if there is no event journal configured for this object

      • hasEventJournal

        boolean hasEventJournal(ObjectNamespace namespace)
        Returns true if the object has a configured and enabled event journal.
        Parameters:
        namespace - the object namespace
        Returns:
        true if the object has a configured and enabled event journal, false otherwise

      • getEventJournalConfig

        EventJournalConfig getEventJournalConfig(ObjectNamespace namespace)
        Returns the event journal configuration or null if there is none or the journal is disabled for the given namespace.
        Parameters:
        namespace - the object namespace of the specific distributed object
        Returns:
        the journal configuration or null if the journal is not enabled or available

      • toRingbufferConfig

        RingbufferConfig toRingbufferConfig(EventJournalConfig config,
                                    ObjectNamespace namespace)
        Creates a new RingbufferConfig for a ringbuffer that will keep event journal events for a single partition.
        Parameters:
        config - the event journal config
        namespace - the object namespace
        Returns:
        the ringbuffer config for a single partition of the event journal
